channel.title: Test File 1
channel.description: This file contains several "item" elements for testing RSS parsers

item.title: JDBC Programmers Run Amok
item.description: A passing Good-Humor ice cream truck provoked a riot among bored Java programmers at Leviathan Software headquarters in Ukiah, CA. Several programmers were bruised, but no serious injuries were reported.

item.title: Kate Blanchett loves Java
item.description: Movie star Kate Blanchett gushed, "I love Java programming! I feel incrediby sexy when I finally get my JDBC code to compile." Kate's comments at yesterday's Mega-Star Jamboree press conference left veteran celebrity reporters scratching their heads.

item.title: Spring arrives in Athens, GA
item.description: University of Georgia students deserted classes en masse today, as a wave of balmy spring weather hit this beautiful college town. Only the Computer Science majors remained at their posts.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence Experiment leads to problems
item.description: UGA student Lisa Lesser-Known remains under medical observation following an abortive attempt by Artificial Intelligence students to implant a microprocessor in her brain. Ever since the experiment, Ms. Lesser-Known has been walking around campus with a gait like the Munchkins from Wizard of Oz, singing old show tunes. Her friends are concerned, but describe her behavior as "normal, for Lisa anyway."

item.title: Spring training draws record crowds
item.description: Attendance at Major League Baseball spring training games in Florida could top the 1.6 million record set the last two years. Figures released Friday by the Florida Sports Foundation show more than 858,000 fans have gone to Grapefruit League games at 17 ball parks statewide. Average attendance for each of the 145 games played through Thursday was 5,921, with some parks getting nearly twice that number for some games. The New York Yankees have maintained their state lead with average attendance of 10,302 at Legends Field in Tampa. However, their biggest crowd so far this month was 11,049 on March 8 when they played the Atlanta Braves at Wide World of Sports. Boosting the Cactus League attendance was the renewed interest in the Detroit Tigers, with 7,375 fans per game at Joker Marchant Stadium. ---www.springtraingingonline.com
